column4: Hello all, I upgraded from 10.04 to 10.10 on my 1201N netbook and now my wifi has stopped working, can anyone help me out
Hello all, I upgraded from 10.04 to 10.10 on my 1201N netbook and now my wifi has stopped working, can anyone help me out
if you run: sudo lshw -C network     you can find the chip and search for guides. If you compiled your wifi driver you will need to recompile it against the new driver (for example)
it worked natively in 10.04 so I did no compiling myself
then you may need to remove the driver and then reinstall it to make it fly
how do I remove it?
well, i have no idea what wireless chip you have. If you tell me I may be able to tell you
rtl8192SE   realtech
it just says "PCI (sysfs)" when i run that command
wait a whil, it'll say
ok it came up,  where does it say the driver in use?
read the text, it says
no driver is listed
so I dont think a driver is installed. I have tried the driver from realtek website (followed the directions, make then make install then reboot) and still doesnt work
read the capabilities section
sudo lshw -C network | grep driver    should show you
the capabilities line for the wireless says "  capabilities: pm msi pciexpress bus_master cap_list"   there is a driver listed for my wired network though
when i try to make install for the linux drivers from realtek I get an error on it and it doesnt install it seems
you may have to install the backport modules
linux-backports-modules-wireless-maverick-generic  is that the right backport?
sounds good to me :)
installing that backport and then make install the wifi drivers still didnt work. still gave an error
